What Are Verifiable Credentials (VC)?

Verifiable Credentials (VC) are cryptographically protected digital documents that securely authenticate identity, qualifications, and rights. Built on standards like the W3C's VC Data Model, they ensure privacy, security, and trust in digital interactions.

How it can be used:
- Identity Verification: Replace traditional methods (usernames/passwords) to enhance security and reduce fraud.
- Credential Verification: Streamline verification of qualifications (diplomas, certifications) in hiring and education.
- Access Control: Improve security for accessing sensitive information (healthcare records, financial transactions).
- User Consent Management: Simplify consent verification in data sharing, ensuring compliance and transparency.
- E-commerce Trust: Enhance trust between buyers and sellers by verifying seller credentials or product authenticity.

ü™™Digital IDs by $IOTA reach a new milestone!

Earlier this week we saw IOTA launch an official Digital Product Passport (DPP) prototype for the EU.

This has been a long time coming since 2021.

Initially IOTA was building Digital ID solutions for the EU's testing program under the European Blockchain Services Infrastructure (EBSI) program.

More specifically, we saw IOTA selected to the EBSI's Pre Commercial Procurement (PCP).

This began in 2021 with the initial Phase I.

Since then over the past couple years we'd seen IOTA advance from Phase I all the way to the final Phase II B.

Phase II B ended in Q3-Q4 last year.

The conclusion was that IOTA's solution alongside their partners had come to a success for Digital IDs!

After that things went kinda quiet with the EU for a bit & some were thinking if this was the end of the road for the past few years of IOTA x EU.

Then suddenly out of nowhere in June 2024... We saw IOTA added to the EU's Blockchain Sandbox.

This sandbox builds on top of all the PCP innovations in EBSI plus many other use case concepts!

Now IOTA & their partners now spearheads the Digital ID initiative within the EU Sandbox.

On the other hand, it does appear that there'll be some overlap in utility with $CHEQ which is also another Digital ID project in the Sandbox.

While IOTA builds the Digital ID system, the goal appears to have interoperability with the trust registry built between Cheqd & their partners.

And now just most recently, we'd seen IOTA & the EU take it a notch higher.

This was through the official launch of a Digital Product Passport prototype being launched.

The PoC that IOTA had been building with the EU for these past few years is really coming together.

This solution will be applied to electronics to better understand and manage lifecycles for sustainability.

‚Ä¢ Distribution of products
‚Ä¢ Use stage once purchased by retail
‚Ä¢ Data logs on repairs & upgrades
‚Ä¢ End of lifecycle for recycle or disposal 

Truly assigning immutable identities to electronics in a way we haven't seen before.

Time after time, it seems they continue to live up and even exceed the EU's expectations.
